attributes.action: scrap the £12 billion road building programme and invest the money in public transport and making cycling and walking more attractive to reduce CO2
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The government has approved over 200 new road schemes which total over £12 billion.  This includes £3.7 billion to widen the M1, and £1.6 billion to widen the M25.  Experience shows that the new road space will soon fill up and encourage more traffic growth.  This money would be better spent investing in measures that would cut traffic growth and CO2 emissions: better public transport and making cycling and walking more attractive.  These schemes are far better value for money, improve our quality of life, and  reduce CO2 emissions.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "scrap the £12 billion road building programme and invest the money in public transport and making cycling and walking more attractive to reduce CO2."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11980.asp

Prime Minister's Office

Environment Secretary Hilary Benn has written a message exclusively for people who recently signed petitions on the No10 website about climate change.

Mr Benn highlights the UK Government's commitment to seeking international agreement on a post-2012 climate change framework, and encourages petitioners, their families, and friends, to use the new CO2 Calculator.

Read the message here:
http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page13496.asp
